properties.title: How To: Convert project data from one format to another
properties.author: Jon Iles

section.name: How To: Convert project data from one format to another
section.p: To convert project data between different formats you read the source data using an appropriate Reader class, the write the data using a Writer class which matches the format you want to convert to.

MPXJ can do a lot of the work for you, as the example below illustrates. This example works where you have source and target file formats which can be easily recognised by the file extension (for example .mpp, .mpx, .xer, and so on)
If you already explicitly know the file types you are converting between, you can use the specific Reader and Writer classes, as shown below.

The following conversions are possible using MPXJ:
Microsoft Project MPP to Microsoft Project MPX
Microsoft Project MPP to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
Microsoft Project MPP to Gnome Planner
Microsoft Project MPX to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
Microsoft Project MPX to Gnome Planner
Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI) to Microsoft Project MPX
Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI) to Gnome Planner
Microsoft Project MPD to Microsoft Project MPX
Microsoft Project MPD to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
Microsoft Project MPD to Gnome Planner
Primavera PM XML to Microsoft Project MPX
Primavera PM XML to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
Primavera PM XML to Gnome Planner
Primavera XER to Microsoft Project MPX
Primavera XER to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
Primavera XER to Gnome Planner
Gnome Planner to Microsoft Project MPX
Gnome Planner to Microsoft Project XML (MSPDI)
